title: ICE with closure destructuring &str

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
When using `.iter().all(|(&&_, &_) do_stuff())` on the current nightly (2016-04-11), I get ICE. Details below.

Somewhat reduced test case:

``` rust
use std::collections::BTreeMap;

fn main() {
    let mut m = BTreeMap::new();
    m.insert("a", true);
    let b = m.iter().all(|(&&_, &_)| true);
}
```
## Meta

I ran the above test case on playpen today, saw error on stable, beta, and nightly.

Backtrace:

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: rows.iter().all(|r| r.len() == v.len())', ../src/librustc_const_eval/check_match.rs:690
```
